metadata.synopsis: Main dialog for the ringmaster - a necromancer lady and the owner of the circus. She has her own tent where she trains dancing skeleton troupe, but after combat with Dribbles she runs to the combat scene and will ask player some questions.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Bottom branch - simply approach her and speak to her.Middle branch - approach the stage with dribbles, 1,1,1 through the dialogue, do killcombat in recon. Lucretious will walk towards the stage, and you can get the Dribbles quest then.Top branches - accept the quest/finish the quest.

2.speaker: Lucretious
2.text: Thank you for finding Dribbles, darling. Be sure you don't forget me, hm?

8.speaker: Lucretious
8.text: I hope you've cleared your schedule, darling, because I need my Dribbles found. You will be compensated, of course.

23.speaker: Lucretious
23.text: Lucille, it's posé, grapevine, then pivot step. Jacob, you have the grace of my great-grandmother's missing leg.
23.context: NodeContext: Yelling sassily at skeletons she is trying to teach to dance.

17.speaker: Lucretious
17.text: And Boris, BORIS. Put some sensuality into those lovely hip bones! I know you have it in you. Step. It. Up.
17.context: NodeContext: Frustrated but trying, in her own way, to be encouraging

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Come quickly. The dryad is in trouble - she disappeared!

90.speaker: Lucretious
90.text: Firstly - hello. I'm Lucretious: ringmaster, necromancer, Bringer of the Night - oh, and wine-lover extraordinaire.
90.context: NodeContext: bemused that player has come up

6.speaker: Lucretious
6.text: Secondly - while you panicking about my Zethino is nothing shy of adorable, there is no need. She's likely off partying in the Feywild - lucky thing.

5.speaker: Lucretious
5.text: She'll come back when she's ready - she always does. Now, stroll on, darling - I have skellies to train.

19.speaker: Lucretious
19.text: Interrupting a massacre, Myrkul help me. These three make the art of dance look like ritual sacrifice.

35.speaker: Lucretious
35.text: Call me Lucretious: ringmaster, necromancer, Bringer of the Night - oh, and wine-lover extraordinaire.
35.context: NodeContext: a little flirty - she's fabulous and she knows it.

53.speaker: Lucretious
53.text: Normally I'd invite you into my tent for a lovely vintage, but these graceless skellies need my full attention. Enjoy my circus, darling!

31.speaker: Lucretious
31.text: We are decades from that. I hoped they could open for Dribbles - not that my star needs the support, but at this rate... who knows?

10.speaker: Lucretious
10.text: Harsh would be telling Jacob that I accidentally resurrected him - I thought his corpse belonged to his much better looking twin.

80.speaker: Lucretious
80.text: Don't look at me like that, Jacob - I didn't say it.
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: I would love a shot of Jacob looking really sad (but not a priority)

27.speaker: Lucretious
27.text: Jacob, you mess up that pivot one more time, and I will put you back in the ground. Not now, darling.

29.speaker: Lucretious
29.text: That is NOT my Dribbles! I WILL REND THAT PESTILENT IMPOSTOR LIMB FROM LIMB.
29.context: NodeContext: the composed, carefree Lucretious has absolutely lost it. Near frothing at the mouth angry (the fight on the stage is ongoing, and she's just realised it's not the real dribbles)

57.speaker: Lucretious
57.text: Oh dear. Screaming children, an oozing corpse - and it's not even my birthday.

67.speaker: Lucretious
67.text: Lucretious: ringmaster, necromancer, Bringer of the Night - oh, and wine-lover extraordinaire. It's a pleasure, darling.

51.speaker: Lucretious
51.text: I thought the Absolute wouldn't dare set foot in my circus. To use such a woeful Dribbles impersonator - why, it's downright rude.

64.speaker: Lucretious
64.text: As much as I love a good murder, my customers don't. The real Dribbles charms animals and makes puns. Awful puns. Not - this.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: You just lost the star of your show - aren't you bothered?

45.speaker: Lucretious
45.text: When you run a plane-hopping circus of ragtags and ruffians, few things faze you.

83.speaker: Lucretious
83.text: Alas, I cannot afford to lose any more staff - funerals are so very expensive. I need to move the circus.

55.speaker: Lucretious
55.text: But I cannot leave just yet - not without Dribbles. He was a star - customers of every colour and creed simply adored him.

73.speaker: Lucretious
73.text: I need him back, and I'll shower the person who finds him in love, adoration, and adequate compensation. What do you say?
73.context: NodeContext: turned up the charm to full

1.speaker: Lucretious
1.text: Heh. I can respect that. And you're in luck - because I am old, darling. Ancient. I have seen stars explode and civilisations fall.
1.context: NodeContext: serious with a slight smirk

13.speaker: Lucretious
13.text: Along the way, I happened across items of such power, they would make you weep with awe.

30.speaker: Lucretious
30.text: Find my Dribbles - you won't be disappointed.

16.speaker: Lucretious
16.text: That's the spirit, darling - and remember, I look after those who make me happy, hm?

20.speaker: Lucretious
20.text: Good luck, and thanks ever so much.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Dribbles is dead. The doppelganger killed him.

28.speaker: Lucretious
28.text: Oh, well - at least he won't complain about extra rehearsals anymore. Find his corpse for me, will you, darling?

34.speaker: Lucretious
34.text: I'll resurrect him - the show must go on, after all! Perhaps I'll make some improvements along the way.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: I've actually found Dribbles, or parts of him, at least.

33.speaker: Lucretious
33.text: Ohhh, getting hacked up like that must have been unpleasant - poor dear.
33.context: NodeContext: absolutely no sympathy in her voice here - like she's commenting on the weather

58.speaker: Lucretious
58.text: If you bring whatever you find to me, I'll take it from there. I'm a necromancer after all - and I do so love a challenge.
58.context: NodeContext: more excited at the prospect of a challenge

76.speaker: Lucretious
76.text: Even better! Corpses are wonderful employees.

81.speaker: Lucretious
81.text: They aren't picky about things like 'working from home' or 'eating'.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Dribbles is dead, but perhaps I could help you resurrect him?

3.speaker: Lucretious
3.text: Darling, you know half the fun with these things is getting your own hands dirty.

79.speaker: Lucretious
79.text: I'll resurrect him myself - I just need you to find him for me.

70.speaker: Lucretious
70.text: Then take care of your affairs and return to me. I trust no one else to find my Dribbles!
70.context: NodeContext: sassy - expecting player to return asap

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I spoke to his corpse - this was planned. You should be worried.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: This whole circus would be dead if not for me. You should have been here.

69.speaker: Lucretious
69.text: You do not live to see the turn of millennia by being stupid - sorry. 'Brave'.

61.speaker: Lucretious
61.text: But since you're so eager to offer your opinion - perhaps you can help me. Dribbles was the star of my show.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I don't know, I enjoyed myself. Killing clowns is a rare treat.

65.speaker: Lucretious
65.text: If that's your idea of fun, darling, you and I are going to get along swimmingly.

72.speaker: Lucretious
72.text: Hello again, my vicious little warrior. Any luck finding Dribbles?

22.speaker: Player
22.text: This is every part of Dribbles I could find.

59.speaker: Lucretious
59.text: Oh, perfection. This is just what I need. His flesh has a few rat bites, and his teeth are missing, but these are minor issues.
59.context: NodeContext: running through (mentally) all the pieces of dribbles the player has brought her

24.speaker: Lucretious
24.text: I shall remake Dribbles better than before. Where once he was famous, he will now become legend!
24.context: NodeContext: excited - thinking of all the money she will make

36.speaker: Lucretious
36.text: And you - here, darling. A little something from your friend Lucretious. My circus and I can now finally leave.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: It's a big circus - how are you going to get out of the city?

25.speaker: Lucretious
25.text: It's called 'magic', darling - do keep up.

71.speaker: Lucretious
71.text: Not this instant, so should you wish for anything from my staff - be quick.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: It was a pleasure to meet you, Lucretious.

0.speaker: Lucretious
0.text: And I you, you delectable vintage.

11.speaker: Lucretious
11.text: Oh, and if you do take on the Absolute - do try not to end up like poor Dribbles. You are so very pretty, after all.
11.context: NodeContext: very cheerful despite how horridying her words are

40.speaker: Player
40.text: You wouldn't happen to be hiring, would you?

84.speaker: Lucretious
84.text: As much fun as you and I would have on the road, alas no. I think we both know you're destined for greater things.
84.context: NodeContext: flirty but also unusually serious - she's sincere here

89.speaker: Player
89.text: I've actually found Dribbles, or parts of him, at least.

14.speaker: Lucretious
14.text: Oh dear - Dribbles' flesh is near torn asunder. Poor thing was most certainly alive when he was hacked up.
14.context: NodeContext: more focused on the amatuer work - doesn't particular car that dribbles was alive

46.speaker: Lucretious
46.text: Well, that just means this treasure hunt is all the more challenging. Toddle on, darling - there's more of Dribbles to find!
46.context: NodeContext: tone change, very much cheerful and shrugging off the horror

48.speaker: Lucretious
48.text: I'd hurry if I were you. In this heat, things tend to get ripe rather quickly... if you catch my meaning.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Come quickly. The dryad is in trouble - she disappeared!

21.speaker: Lucretious
21.text: Another Zethino fan? Aren't you just the sweetest thing.
21.context: NodeContext: little condescending (zethino has A LOT) of fans.

75.speaker: Lucretious
75.text: She's likely off partying in the Feywild. She'll be back when she's tuckered out. Don't worry - she does this all the time.
